instructions: Wash the beet greens thoroughly, chop them into pieces, and place them in a wide pot without water. Cook on low heat to steam until all the moisture evaporates (the greens will look an unappealing green color).
Add half a cup of oil and sauté until the leaves turn a dark green color.
For the sauce: Combine 2 cups of white beans, meat cubes, garlic, and salt in a pot. Add cilantro and dill. Take 2 cups of the sauce and mix in the white beans.
notes: This dish is a traditional Tunisian-Djerban Jewish recipe, often enjoyed during festive occasions. The beet greens provide a unique flavor and are a nutritious addition to the meal.
